verses.text: I love the LORD, for he heard my voice; he heard my cry for mercy.
Because he turned his ear to me, I will call on him as long as I live.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 116
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 116 An exuberant thanksgiving to the Lord for delivering the psalmist from death. It is impossible to be precise about the threat that hung over the psalmist (perhaps sickness), but he looks back to his cry of distress to the Lord and proclaims with gladness that God heard him. As a result, he determines to offer sacrifices to the Lord. For the use of this psalm at a feast, see introduction to Ps. 113.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 116:1
rsbNotes.text: 116:1 I love the Lord. The psalmist expresses his deep affection for the Lord, grounding it in God’s own love toward him. God showed His love for the psalmist by hearing his prayer.

verses.text: The cords of death entangled me, the anguish of the grave came upon me; I was overcome by trouble and sorrow.
Then I called on the name of the LORD: "O LORD, save me!"

rsbNotes.title: Ps 116:3
rsbNotes.text: 116:3 The snares of death. It was as if ropes came out of a grave, pulling the psalmist into the ground.

verses.text: The LORD is gracious and righteous; our God is full of compassion.
The LORD protects the simplehearted; when I was in great need, he saved me.
Be at rest once more, O my soul, for the LORD has been good to you.
For you, O LORD, have delivered my soul from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling,
that I may walk before the LORD in the land of the living.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 116:5
rsbNotes.text: 116:5 Gracious . . . righteous . . . merciful. God reveals His kindness in His answer to the psalmist’s request. He does not stand at a distance when His people suffer.

verses.text: I believed; therefore I said, "I am greatly afflicted."

rsbNotes.title: Ps 116:10
rsbNotes.text: 116:10 when I spoke. It was the psalmist’s faith in God that led him (see text note) to pray to Him in the beginning.

verses.text: And in my dismay I said, "All men are liars."
How can I repay the LORD for all his goodness to me?

rsbNotes.title: Ps 116:11
rsbNotes.text: 116:11 “All mankind are liars.” He remembers his complaint; he apparently had been the object of a false accusation.

verses.text: I will lift up the cup of salvation and call on the name of the LORD.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 116:13
rsbNotes.text: 116:13 the cup of salvation. This may be a reference to a drink offering (Num. 15:10), but it is more likely a metaphor, contrasting with the more common “cup” of God’s wrath (Ps. 75:8).

verses.text: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all his people.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 116:14
rsbNotes.text: 116:14 in the presence of all his people. The psalmist promises to proclaim publicly God’s great acts (Ps. 22:22 note).

verses.text: Precious in the sight of the LORD is the death of his saints.
O LORD, truly I am your servant; I am your servant, the son of your maidservant; you have freed me from my chains.
I will sacrifice a thank offering to you and call on the name of the LORD.
I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all his people,

rsbNotes.title: Ps 116:15
rsbNotes.text: 116:15 Precious. Their deaths, like their lives, are significant and important to God. See “Death and the Intermediate State” at Phil. 1:23.

verses.text: in the courts of the house of the LORD - in your midst, O Jerusalem. Praise the LORD.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 116:19
rsbNotes.text: 116:19 the courts of the house of the Lord. The temple in Jerusalem.
